DataElement.preferredName: Eligibility Criteria Current Dexamethasone or Equivalent Alternative Corticosteroid Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Eligibility criteria indicator of whether or not the patient is receiving dexamethasone or equivalent of an alternative corticosteroid.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Current Dexamethasone Or Equivalent Alternative Corticosteroid Therapeutic Procedure
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria._Occurring in or belonging to the present time._A synthetic adrenal corticosteroid with potent anti-inflammatory properties. In addition to binding to specific nuclear steroid receptors, dexamethasone also interferes with NF-kB activation and apoptotic pathways. This agent lacks the salt-retaining properties of other related adrenal hormones. (NCI04)_An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise._A person or thing equal to another in value or measure or force or effect or significance etc; being essentially equal to something._Available in place of something else._Hormones synthesized in the cortex of the adrenal gland and consist of two subclasses, glucocorticoids (carbohydrate regulation) and mineralocorticoids (electrolyte regulation)._An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Property.preferredName: Current Dexamethasone Or Equivalent Alternative Corticosteroid Therapeutic Procedure
Property.preferredDefinition: Occurring in or belonging to the present time.:A synthetic adrenal corticosteroid with potent anti-inflammatory properties. In addition to binding to specific nuclear steroid receptors, dexamethasone also interferes with NF-kB activation and apoptotic pathways. This agent lacks the salt-retaining properties of other related adrenal hormones. (NCI04):An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.:A person or thing equal to another in value or measure or force or effect or significance etc; being essentially equal to something.:Available in place of something else.:Hormones synthesized in the cortex of the adrenal gland and consist of two subclasses, glucocorticoids (carbohydrate regulation) and mineralocorticoids (electrolyte regulation).:An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.

Concepts.definition: Occurring in or belonging to the present time.

A synthetic adrenal corticosteroid with potent anti-inflammatory properties. In addition to binding to specific nuclear steroid receptors, dexamethasone also interferes with NF-kB activation and apoptotic pathways. This agent lacks the salt-retaining properties of other related adrenal hormones. (NCI04)

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
A person or thing equal to another in value or measure or force or effect or significance etc.; being essentially equal to something.
Available in place of something else.
Hormones synthesized in the cortex of the adrenal gland and consist of two subclasses, glucocorticoids (carbohydrate regulation) and mineralocorticoids (electrolyte regulation).
An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for 1403 study in Rave per request by J.Zhao.mc 8/14/15

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Is the patient receiving dexa
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the patient receiving dexamethasone (or equivalent of an alternative corticosteroid)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: 1501 Question
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient been receiving greater than 1 mg dexamethasone/day (or an equivalent amount of an alternative corticosteroid) for at least 1 week prior to treatment start?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the patient receiving dexamethasone on a stable or decreasing dose for at least 14 days prior to study entry?
